summary: The 'National Training Center for Counter-Unmanned Aircraft Systems Act' amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002. It mandates the Attorney General, in coordination with the Secretary of Homeland Security, to establish counter-UAS (unmanned aircraft system) training programs, potentially through designated facilities or training centers.  The bill also requires the Secretary and Attorney General, in coordination with the FAA, to set standards for training and certification for individuals operating counter-UAS detection and mitigation systems, considering aviation safety and establishing interagency coordination. The bill defines UAS and related terminology.
